title: How to Heat Milk Without Scalding

steps.title: To heat milk for a recipe or for child/adult consumption, use a small stovetop pot.
steps.content: To heat milk for a recipe or for child/adult consumption, use a small stovetop pot. There are proper milk saucepans that you can purchase if you wish.

steps.title: Heat low.
steps.content: Heat low. If milk gets too hot, it bubbles over before you even know it has happened. Use a high heat and keep your eye on it.

steps.title: Heat slow.
steps.content: Heat slow. Exercise patience. Ignore the temptation to raise the heat to cook it faster. Stir it continuously to avoid solids sticking to the bottom and burning.

steps.title: Test the temperature.
steps.content: Test the temperature. Make sure it's warm, but not so hot it will burn your mouth. Use a teaspoon to collect some milk from the pot, hold your wrist over the spoon to check the temperature, and if it isn't ridiculously hot, give it a taste.

steps.title: To heat milk for infant consumption, put the milk in a sterile bottle.
steps.content: To heat milk for infant consumption, put the milk in a sterile bottle. Heat the bottle in a pot of water, the microwave (if the bottle is microwave safe), or in a bottle warmer.
